subject: Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: Todd Pletcher, named the nation’s outstanding trainer each of the last four years, faces a possible suspension. A horse he trains, Wait a While, tested positive for a prohibited drug, Procaine, after her third-place finish on Oct. 24 in the Breeders’ Cup Filly & Mare Turf at Santa Anita. The California Horse Racing Board filed a complaint against Pletcher after receiving the positive result from a laboratory. Procaine is a local anesthetic that is found in penicillin. The minimum penalty for use of the drug is 30 days. In a statement, Pletcher said that Wait a While had been treated with penicillin but that he thought it would no longer be in her system by the time she raced in the Breeders’ Cup.
